content: Googling did not turn up much. Are there multiple linters that I should run?
You can do lake exe runLinter in the root of Mathlib repo

It also depends on which linters you want to run. If you use Batteries, then #lint will run a set of "standard" linters on the current file up until the #lint command is issued. Normally, you would write #lint at the bottom of the file.
If it is the Mathlib linters that you want to run, they should be automatically running in Mathlib itself.

If you are in a project that imports Mathlib, then some are on by default, some are off. You can turn them on individually, but there is no "out of the box" command to align linting of downstream projects with mathlib linters.
You can take a look at #FLT > apply mathlib linters? @ ðŸ’¬ for a portion of a lakefile.toml file for seeing how to make the syntax linters active.
Dominic Steinitz has marked this topic as resolved.

Damiano Testa said:

It also depends on which linters you want to run. If you use Batteries, then #lint will run a set of "standard" linters on the current file up until the #lint command is issued. Normally, you would write #lint at the bottom of the file.

To clarify: #lint at the end of a file also runs all environment linters defined in mathlib. (And lake exe runLinter basically runs #lint on every file in mathlib/the project you're running it in.)

Damiano Testa said:

If it is the Mathlib linters that you want to run, they should be automatically running in Mathlib itself.

This refers to the syntax linters - these produce warnings on your code directly.
